$ORCL $CERN  
 
However, Weiss said that Oracle (ORCL) has not yet given a "more comprehensive look at the rationale behind the Cerner (CERN) transaction. Weiss explained that Oracle's (ORCL) guidance doesn't include any contributions from Cerner (CERN), such as how much the the deal might add to Oracle's (ORCL) business in the first year after it closes. 
 
Weiss said that from a strategic perspective, "[Oracle] management views the healthcare vertical as highly strategic," and is focused on combining Cerner's industry relationships with Oracle's "industry-specific features to deliver an integrated offering." 
 
Bank of America analyst Brad Sills highlighted Oracle's (ORCL) cloud strength, but noted that generating mid-20% cloud revenue growth in could be unattainable, "given consistent mid high teens estimated in [the third quarter] and recent quarters." Sills lowered his price target on Oracle's (ORCL) stock to $90 a share from $105, following the results.
